subject: Data
title: Qualitative vs. Quantitative: Not All Data Has Numbers
description: A quick win: understand Qualitative vs. Quantitative: Not All Data Has Numbers.

hook.text: A restaurant has a 4.2-star rating and 300 reviews saying 'the pasta is incredible.' Which tells you more?

buildup.text: Quantitative data uses numbers â€” counts, measurements, percentages. It's easy to compare and calculate.

discovery.text: Qualitative data uses descriptions â€” words, observations, feelings. It captures nuance numbers can't.

twist.text: The best insights come from combining both. Numbers show what happened; words explain why.

climax.text: Data literacy means knowing which type of data to trust for which type of question.

punchline.text: Numbers tell what. Stories tell why. You need both.

quiz.question: What's the main advantage of qualitative data over quantitative?
options: It captures nuance and context that numbers miss
